After 20+ hours, I'm genuinely impressed with FC 25. The gameplay feels more realistic than ever - player movements are smoother, and the new tactical options add real depth to matches. Ultimate Team is still addictive (though expensive), and Career Mode finally got some meaningful updates. The women's leagues integration is fantastic. Yes, it has the usual EA issues with servers and microtransactions, but the core football experience is solid. Worth it if you're a football fan.

Rating: 8/10 - Recommended
I don't play FC much, but I've been enjoying this game lately. Don't care about the online matches though. Kickoff is really fun.

EA Sports FC 25 delivers smooth, realistic gameplay with improved animations and smarter AI. Ultimate Team is still very engaging, and Career Mode gets some nice quality-of-life upgrades. While it doesn‚Äôt reinvent the series and still has some bugs and heavy microtransactions, it‚Äôs a solid and enjoyable football experience overall.

EA FC25 is a fantastic purchase‚Ä¶ mostly because it saves you from buying EA FC26, which is basically FC25 with a new logo slapped on like a cheap sticker. Honestly, why pay again for the same thing? EA already perfected the art of Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V.

Gameplay? Oh, it‚Äôs exactly the same.
Mechanics? Carbon copy.
‚ÄúNew features‚Äù? Yeah, sure.... if rearranging menus counts as innovation.

So do yourself a favour: buy FC25. You‚Äôll enjoy EA FC26 early, because they‚Äôre literally the same game. Congratulations ‚Äî you‚Äôve just outsmarted EA‚Äôs annual ‚Äúpay full price for nothing new‚Äù tradition.

It's an Fifa so it is worth playing, but EA needs to optimize this game for PC. I have no issue with this game graphic gameplay or anything, the only issue I'm facing is the fluctuation in FPS when I'm playing on my laptop.
When I first purchased it, it was working fine no fluctuation constant 120fps but I don't know what happened after 2-3 months it wasn't running smooth I tried everything but it did't solved the issue for me. Also their is a new bug as well whenever my display is on OPTIMUS the game runs but as I change it to DISCRETE GPU it doesn't work. Don't know what is the issue with this game. I played it ROG ALLY it was working fine but in my laptop it is trash.

To sum it all, buy it on sale and hope that bugs won't affect you.

Better realism, animations & physicality ‚Äî Thanks to new technology (HyperMotion V), many players and reviewers note that movements, ball physics, and overall animation quality feel more natural, making dribbles, tackles, and general play look and feel more lifelike.
More management / customisation in Career & Clubs modes ‚Äî FC 25 expands on club-management: for example, you can create clubs, customise stadiums/teams, manage youth/academy, and enjoy a refreshed ‚Äúmanager mode‚Äù feel.

negative.review: The AI is so bad it sometimes makes me just press Alt + F4. Especially in Player Career mode ‚Äî there‚Äôs no point in leveling up my player if the AI is going to decide where my shots will land. This is by far the worst FIFA game I‚Äôve ever played in my life.
EA has to be the worst publisher to have ever existed. Why do I have to log in with EA account to play on Steam, where I purchased the game.

Save your time, sanity, and money.
Stay far away from this game ‚Äî it‚Äôs fully pay-to-win and drowning in microtransactions. 

Every year they recycle the same game with a new player on the cover and somehow make it worse.

They even removed the only good thing ‚Äî the story mode. EA really outdid themselves in disappointment; truly Microtransaction Simulator 25.

Not Recommended

This game is a laggy mess. The performance is terrible on PC because it‚Äôs clearly not optimized at all. Stuttering, input delay, frame drops, you name it. It honestly feels like they slapped new menus on top of the same broken engine and called it a day.

What makes it worse is that the gameplay hasn‚Äôt improved either. In fact, FIFA 14, a 10-year-old game, plays smoother, feels more responsive, and is way more enjoyable than this. It‚Äôs embarrassing that a decade-old title offers a better football experience than a brand-new release.

Unless they fix the optimization and overhaul the gameplay, I can‚Äôt recommend this at all. Total disappointment.

‚öΩ Gameplay
EA SPORTS FC‚Ñ¢ 25 feels more like a minor update than a true evolution. The mechanics are familiar, almost identical to the previous entry, and matches often feel unbalanced. Attacking is overpowered, while defending feels clunky and unrewarding. Instead of realism, the game leans toward an arcade style that doesn‚Äôt capture the depth of football strategy.

üéÆ Modes & Features
Ultimate Team and Career Mode return, but with very little innovation. The new additions don‚Äôt feel substantial enough to justify calling this a fresh experience. Rush mode is interesting at first, but quickly becomes repetitive. For players who expected a bold step forward after the FIFA era, this feels underwhelming.

üëé Weak Points
Too similar to last year‚Äôs game.

Gameplay balance issues make matches frustrating.

Lack of meaningful new features.

Feels more like a reskin than a new release.

üéØ Final Verdict
EA SPORTS FC‚Ñ¢ 25 is polished but uninspired. If you‚Äôre hoping for a football game that pushes boundaries, this one may leave you disappointed. It caters more to casual play than to fans who value realism, strategy, and innovation.

Both the online and offline gameplay experience are horrible. Even Fortnite is a better developed game than this (I HATE FORTNITE). No matter how good your internet, SKILLS, settings, PC/ console and input devices are this game will purposely fight your inputs and follow a script to let your opponent score some very dumb goals and you miss dead on goals, especially if you win too many matches back to back. 

The passing will have you tweaking, I swear it will purposely give your opponent the ball after a few very good passes.

I have done multiple driven shots and sometimes the ball goes flying over the bar (Yes I time it very well I play on 180hz and 120fps or more). The training grounds is rubbish, it is nothing like a real match. Some games the computer will give you a fair game and others make you want to break your controller and everything you own.
 
Check online and you will see that a bunch of people have the same exact issues.
